quiz.text: Find the area of field ‘A’ (in m²).
options: 156√3
144√3
148√3
136√3
112√3

quiz.text: Find the cost of fencing field ‘C’ at the rate of Rs 4/meter.
options: Rs 900
Rs 540
Rs 780
Rs 660
Rs 440

quiz.text: The length of each side of an equilateral triangular field is how much percent more/less than the length of the rectangular field?
options: 4%
8%
5%
6.25%
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of the perimeters of field ‘B’ and a squared field ‘E’ is 8:7, respectively. Find the cost of cultivating 20% of field ‘E’ at the rate of Rs. 8/m².
options: Rs.1540
Rs.1620
Rs.1840
Rs.1960
Rs.2040

quiz.text: Find the ratio of the length of the squared field to the diameter of the circular field.
options: 8: 7
4: 3
5: 2
2: 1
9: 5

quiz.text: In ΔABC, AB = BC and the angle bisector of ∠A and ∠C meet at point ‘P’. If ratio of measure of ∠ABC and ∠ACB is 8:5, respectively, then find the measure of (∠APC – ∠APB).
options: 15°
20°
30°
50°
45°

quiz.text: The area of a rhombus is 480 cm²and the ratio of the length of its diagonals is 12:5. What is the height of the rhombus?
options: (260/9) cm
(240/13) cm
(200/11) cm
(250/13) cm
(230/12) cm

quiz.text: In a parallelogram ABCD, the ratio of the measure of ∠A to that of ∠D is 3:7, respectively. Find the measure of (∠B – ∠C).
options: 60°
72°
54°
126°
105°

quiz.text: In a ΔMNO, ∠M - ∠N = 16° and ∠N – ∠O = 28°, what is the sum of the smallest and the largest angle of the triangle?
options: 108°
112°
116°
120°
115°

quiz.text: In the given figure, ‘O’ is the centre of the circle and SM is tangent. If ∠MSP = 42°, then find the measure of ∠MQS.
options: 120°
114°
108°
126°
145°

quiz.text:
In the question, two quantities I and II are given. You have to solve both the quantities to establish the correct relation between Quantity-I and Quantity-II and choose the correct option.

Quantity-I: The ratio of the lengths of two rulers is 1:2 (in cm). When each of them is used to measure a length of 450 meter separately, the sum of the number of times they are used to do so is 4500. Find the length of the smaller ruler.

Quantity-II: A square paper has the sides equal to the breadth of a rectangular paper whose length and breadth are in the ratio 5:4. The perimeter of the square paper is 48 cm. Find the length of the rectangular paper.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text:
Quantity-I:  Mysuru Express of length (x + 60) m, can cross a platform of length (x – 30) m in 13 seconds with the speed of 30 m/s. Find the length of Mysuru Express.

 

Quantity-II:  The perimeter of a rectangular park having length and breadth in the ratio of 5:4, respectively is equal to the perimeter of a square park of length 225 m, find the breadth of a rectangular park.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text:
In the question, two quantities I and II are given. You have to solve both quantities to establish the correct relation between Quantity-I and Quantity-II and choose the correct option.

Quantity I: Perimeter of the square field is 20% less than the circumference of the circular field. Find the area of the square field if the area of the circular field is 1875 cm². (Take π = 3)

Quantity II: The length of the rectangular field is 44% more than its breadth. Find the area of the rectangular field if its perimeter is 122 cm.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text:
In the question, two Quantities I and II are given. You have to solve both Quantities to establish the correct relation between Quantity-I and Quantity-II and choose the correct option.

Quantity I: A rectangular path of width 3 m is made outside around a rectangular park of perimeter 90 m. The ratio of length and breadth of a rectangle is 32:13. Find the area of the path.

Quantity II: Find the area of a rectangle of perimeter of 72 m having the ratio of length and breadth as 11:7.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Find the circumference of the circular park whose area is 5808 m². [Use π = 3]

Quantity II: Find the perimeter of the rectangular park, whose length is 5 metre more than its breadth and area is 4550 m²

Quantity III: 280 metres
options: C, B
C, A
C, C
A, B
B, C

quiz.text: Find the perimeter of the square ‘A’. Statement I: Area of a circle ‘B’ is 825 cm² more than that of the square ‘A’. Statement II: Circumference of the circle ‘B’ is 220 cm. Statement III: The area of a rectangle is 1975 cm² less than that of the square. The ratio of length to breadth of the rectangle is 7:6.
options: The data is statements I and II together are sufficient to answer the question while data in statement III alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I and II or in statement I and III are sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II and III together are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in either of the two statements together is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all the three statements together is necessary to answer the question.
The data in all the three statements together is not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Find the area of the circle.   Statement I: Difference between circumference of the circle and diameter of the circle is 135 cm. Statement II: Circumference of the circle is 130% more than length of a rectangle whose perimeter is 200 cm.
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: Find the area of the hall.  Statement I: The floor of the hall has to be laid with tiles such that cost of tile per m² is Rs. 200. Statement II: The total amount paid to the laborers for the flooring is Rs. 4000. Statement III: The total cost (cost of tiles + amount paid to laborers) of flooring is Rs. 16000.
options: The data in statement I and II together is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement III alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I and III together is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II and III together is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in any of the two statements together is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all the three statements together is necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: What is the area of the plot which is in the shape of a regular polygon?   Statement I: Perimeter of the plot is 736 metres. Statement II: Radius of the largest circle that can be inscribed in the plot is 92 metres. Statement III: Diameter of the largest circle that can be inscribed in the plot is equal to the length of one of the side of the plot.
options: Data given in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question while data given in statement II and statement III together is sufficient to answer the question.
Data given in both statement I and statement III together or data given in both statement II and statement III together is necessary to answer the question
Data given in any of the two statements combined together is sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in all three statements is necessary to answer the question.
The data in all the three statements is not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: In the given figure, there is a circle with centre O and diameter 28 cm, and two triangles AOB and COD. Find the area of the shaded region. Statement I: CD = OA and angle OBA = 45° Statement II: angle CDO = 60° and AB = 14√2 cm.
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: In the given figure ‘O’ is the centre of the circle. AC = BC and ∠CAB = 30°. The measure of ∠AOB is _______.
options: 160°
150°
240°
200°
180°

quiz.text: The perimeter of a trapezium is 52 cm and length of its non-parallel side is 13 cm each. If the ratio of the length of parallel sides of the trapezium is 4:9, then the area of the trapezium is _______ cm2.
options: 156 cm²
144 cm²
168 cm²
126 cm²
150 cm²

quiz.text: The height of an equilateral triangle is 8√3 cm. The perimeter of the given equilateral triangle and a square is equal. The length of diagonal of the square is _______cm.
options: 12√3 cm
15√2 cm
12√2 cm
20√3 cm
None of these

quiz.text: It is given that ∆ ABC is similar to ∆ PQR and D and E are mid–points of side AB and AC respectively such that DE = 2 cm and QR = 5 cm. If the area of ∆ PQR is 40 cm², then the area (in cm²) of ∆ ABC is _______.
options: 21.4
27
15.8
25.6
None of these

quiz.text: A wire is in the shape of a circle of radius 84 cm. If the same wire is reshaped in the form of a rectangle such that ratio of the length to that of breadth of the rectangle thus formed is 15:7, then the area of the rectangle will be _______ cm2.
options: 11260 cm²
14250 cm²
15120 cm²
16840 cm²
14850 cm²
